article.simpara: Hue, http://gethue.com, is an open source UI for Hadoop and its satellite projects.

It makes the whole platform (e.g. HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, Oozie, Pig, Impala, Solr, Sqoop, ZooKeeper…) easy to use and accessible from your browser (e.g. upload files to HDFS, send Hive queries from a Web editor, build workflows with Drag & Drop… all within a single app).

listitem.simpara: The look & feel and navigation bar have been redesigned

simpara.ulink: DBQuery App: MySQL and PostgreSQL Query Editors
Integrate external Web applications in any language
Create Hive tables and load quoted CSV data
Submit any Oozie jobs directly from HDFS
SSO with Hue: new SAML backend
Hive Query editor with HiveServer2 and Sentry

section.title: Compatibility
section.simpara: Runs on CentOS versions 5 to 6, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), and Ubuntu 10.04 to 12.10. CentOS 5 and RHEL 5 requires EPEL python package.

listitem.simpara: Hive 0.12.0
Oozie 4.0
HBase 0.96
Pig 0.12
Impala 1.2
Solr 4.4
Sqoop2 1.99.3

section.simpara: These minimum versions should work (not tested):

listitem.simpara: Hive 0.12.0
Oozie 3.2
HBase 0.92
Pig 0.8
Impala 1.0
Solr 3.6
Sqoop2 1.99.3
Windows: Chrome, Firefox 3.6+, Internet Explorer 9+, Safari 5+
Linux : Chrome, Firefox 3.6+
Mac: Chrome, Firefox 3.6+, Safari 5+
